page.title: 20Prestwood Birth/Transport
page.content: In Prestwood in 1881 about 9 tenths of the population were born in Bucks. Of those not born in Bucks, only 1 in 365 were born abroad. One of these was the Vicar. Of the children in P.M.S. in 1985, 1 in 15 were born abroad, 2 out of 3 were born in Bucks, and about 3 out of 10 were born in U.K. but outside Bucks. Perhaps these facts reflect changes in transport systems. Of P.M.S. children:- 11/12 have used the Tube 19/30 have used a taxi 179/180 have used a bus/coach 7/9 have used a ship or ferry 19/36 have used a passenger airliner 1/6 have used a hovercraft. {Credits: Work done by 4L of P.M.S. was edited and transferred to disc by Colin Le Good - Deputy Head P.M.S.. Photos by Mr. Gary Chidwick. Pages 1 to 7 by Penny Robinson - Class 4L}
